3.131(c) Housekeeping
Two plastic bag lined compost bins in the food preparation kitchen used for the fruit bats were found leaking fluid from the
base of the bins. The fluid surrounded the entire base of each of the bins and was draining across the floor from the larger
of the bins approximately 6 feet until it went under a storage cabinet. The smaller of the two bins was draining beneath a
refrigerator. Also, upon entering the kitchen, a strong smell of fermented fruit was noted. The leaking fluid can not only
lead to vermin and pest infestations, foul odors, and potential disease hazards, but has the potential of contaminating food
preparation utensils, storage and transport devices, and employee apparel and footwear. Premises shall be kept clean
and in good repair in order to protect the animals from injury and to facilitate the prescribed husbandry practices set forth
in this subpart.
Correct by 7/15/24
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
